column4: Hi, I'm trying to install ubuntu on my amd64 system but things keep freezing up during early stages of the install. If I do thing from a terminal, I tend to get messages like "SQUASHFS error: sb_bread failed reading block". Is my ISO broke or something worse?
there are md5 sums and a verify function you can use to answer that question
What I meant was, could by burned CD be broken (I think the ISO is fine)
do you have a tool to compute the md5 sum for the burned cd?
Well, I could make an ISO from the CD and md5sum it, but that ould take a bit of time so I'd rather know if this was the likely problem.
if it boots it is less likely to be broken but maybe.  and CDs can be summed by a decent tool
Ok, so what other sources for this error could there be?

i do not know - i do not have a 64b system to test.  just guessing, disk problems?  memory?  it might be good to know exactly where in the process it fails.  but i am not sure i will be the best answerer
does the live cd work ok for a long time?  i know this is frustrating.
hardware problems seem unlikely since i used the computer for winxp on a daily basis, but I put a new sata drive in it today on which i want to install ubuntu
it freezes up after a little while
right now i've managed to boot it and start the installer
agreed on hardware problems except you just put in a new drive and linux stresses hardware in different ways. very often marginal memory will fail with linux that works with win osses
didn't know that, I'll run a memcheck right away
not 100% guaranteed but this is wtf mode - hard to troubleshoot, i know
ok, bios memtest said ok. last try froze at partitioning... my new sata drive is looking mighty suspicious, but i can't figure out why i'd get squashfs errors from that

i think you are on to something - may be a driver issue or somesuch - i don't have sata drives but it is worth your asking your questions to the group with the assumption that you may have a sata problem
and remove my name or else nobody else might answer  (thanks rioghal)
not that i mind seeing my name :)
kind of new to the ubuntu community so sorry for asking but: what group?
sorry i meant channel as in this channel
ok, thanks... i'll fiddle with the installer a bit more before i ask
